metadata.name: Validate Acceptance Criteria
metadata.description: Ensure acceptance criteria are specific, testable, and verifiable

task.instructions:
# Validate Acceptance Criteria
Ensure all acceptance criteria are specific, testable, and programmatically verifiable.
## Validation Checklist
For each acceptance criterion:
- [ ] **Specific**: Clearly defined with no ambiguity - [ ] **Testable**: Can be verified through automated tests - [ ] **Measurable**: Success/failure is objectively determinable - [ ] **Given-When-Then Format**: Follows standard structure - [ ] **Maps to Tests**: Specific test type identified (unit, integration, E2E)
## Format Requirements
``` Given [context/precondition] When [action/event] Then [expected result] ```
## Examples
**Good Acceptance Criteria**: ``` Given a logged-in user When they submit a valid email address Then the email is saved to the database And a confirmation message is displayed And an email verification is sent ``` **Test Mapping**: Unit test (email validation), Integration test (database save), E2E test (UI flow)
**Bad Acceptance Criteria**: ``` The system should work well Users should be happy with the feature ``` **Why Bad**: Not specific, not testable, not measurable
## Validation Process
1. Review each acceptance criterion 2. Identify any vague or untestable criteria 3. Rewrite using Given-When-Then format 4. Map to specific test types 5. Verify all edge cases covered 6. Document test strategy for each criterion
